721043f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 66th Street (East)
721043f-a.text:
Lexington Ave., west side, south from East 66th Street. On the ex-
treme left, appears a portion of St. Vincent Ferrer R.C. Church (at the S.E.
corner ot East 66th Street).
About t 9z:2 -T
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

721044f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 66th Street (East)
721044f-a.text:
Lexington Ave., west side, north from and including East 66th Street,
showing a crowd congregating for a reason that is unknown to the writer.
Occupying the 66th to 67th Street block is the Seventh Regiment Armory.
About 7 N622215
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

721045f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 66th Street (East)
721045f-a.text:
Lexington Ave., west side, northfrom and including East 66th Street,
showing in the order of their appearance; the 7th Regiment Armory, the
Institution for the Instruction of Deaf Mutes and Thomas Hunter Hall
(of Hunter College).
June 12, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

721050f-b.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 66th Street
721050f-b.text:
(1)
Lexington Ave., west side, south from East 68th to 66th Streets,
showing the Institution for the Instruction of Deaf Mutes occupying
the block front, from 68th to 67th Streets. South of same,and
utilizing the 67th to 66th Street block is the Seventh Regiment Armory.
October 11, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same. Appearing partially on the right is Thomas Hunter Hall,
a unit of Hunter College.
June 12, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
